caption: two days ago was the first time we visited this restaurant. But It is surely not the last. We enjoyed the evening very much with the attentive service, with the exceptional cooking and wine and with the honest charge. We will absolutely go back there again.

I celebrated my PhD yesterday in this fine place. I am glad to say that it was a terrific evening and the place was surely one of the reasons for that outstanding gathering. The crew  collaborated in a graceful style, the food was delicious and my friends were extremely  pleased. We shall surely visit again for more events. thanks very much.

I celebrated my nomination this evening in this gorgeous place. I am glad to say that it was a cool evening and the restaurant was absolutely one of the reasons for the fruitful meeting. The waiters  cooperated in a splendid way, the cuisine was very good and my guests were very  cheerful. We shall surely come back again for more joyful events. Thank you very much.
Great service and awesome selection of import beers and cocktails
Not typical rosebud. Had limited steak options. Linguine with clams was the worst I've ever had.
Too loud.

While the caeser salad was fresh, both the main dishes ordered were not even worth eating. My chicken parmesan tasted like something from a frozen microwave dinner. Yes, the portions are enormous but if the food is horrible, that's not really a bonus.

The two pasta dishes we got were quite good although not quite as good as other Italian restaurants in other cities. The price was fair but there serving sizes are way too big which I am not a fan of so be sure you can eat the leftovers in the upcoming days or else you will waste a lot of food.
The service was surprisingly fast for what qualifies as a "fancy" restaurant.  The food is always good when I go here - the price for drinks is a little higher than ideal but not bad for Chicago.
Tourist trap.  So many better places walking distance.

Great service, About once a week when I am running late and need a quick breakfast I will pop into this express Rosebud's for a breakfast burito special. Literally all i need to eat is a half and I am full for a good portion of the day. The special will include a fresh squeezed OJ or coffee.  This will run you under $6 and is good for two breakfasts. In my mind I think that is a pretty swell deal.  Very hard working and friendly people at this location!!!!
The salmon salad is good
Pretty good Italian place in Chicago. The ambiance and location are great. The food was decent but you get tons of it, so you'll definitely have leftovers. Go here with a group on a special occasion

Started with Brushetta which was fantastic and based on that I really anticipated my meal.  Ordered special for the Friday evening - Petite Steak with Garlic Red Potatos.  Never had a better steak in texture and flavor. (Well, maybe in France).  But I think that I have tasted the sauce for the steak in a Stouffer's Salsbury Steak.  I like to at least taste the garlic in garlic mash potatoes.  The bar is not separate from the dining room which I will take note of in the future.  On a Friday you are going to get way too much noise from the bar to have any kind of dinner conversation.  A redesign should be considered but it was my bad for not seeing that before sitting down.  Service was very attentive.

When I first saw and heard of Rosebud I really felt it was going to be overpriced fair that wasn't worth my dime.  I am happy to announce that I was wrong. This became one of my favorite spots to eat at for awhile and I still love coming here.  The Veal and the Chicken dishes are both spectacular.  While I do enjoy this Rosebud I have to say the one on Rush is probably my favorite of their spots that I've tried.

The happy hour appetizer buffet is a good deal. I used to work in the same building as this place so my coworkers and I would frequently make carry-out orders from them during dinner. The food is reasonably good but it is definitely NOT healthy (lots of olive oil, butter, cheese etc.). The menu is not very extensive. But the seating areas in the open-air lobby are nice. The place gets PACKED during lunch and before theater events.
We stumbled upon this restaurant as we were looking for somewhere reasonable to eat. The food was decent and our server was very attentive and treated us well.

The Lamb Salad for lunch at Rosebud Theater District is absolutely delicious. My marinated and grilled lamb medallions were freshly sliced and prepared medium rare over mixed greens with feta cheese, roasted red peppers, cucumbers, tomatoes, kalamata olives with a house vinaigrette. Every bite was better than the last. This is one salad that everyone should try.

My Veal parmesan from Rosebud was just perfect last Friday night. I couldn't say better things about the food or service. Rosebud Theater District is also the home for Rosebud Express which is a daily lunch Hot Spot for me and entire office. Love Rosebud and really enjoy the desserts.

As one of Chicago's Top Foodie's, I prefer to dine at real restaurants that are down to earth and casual. Of course many consider the Rosebud Restaurants Fine Dining. I think all of them are upscale, but yet casual and not stuck up, so that's where the down to earth style of restaurant comes in. When we go to various theater productions we make it a point to dine in the loop at Rosebud Theater District. George is the General Manager and has always made sure we are personally taken care of. The man does know me or my family but treates us like we are his best friends and really makes Rosebud a warm and inviting place to enjoy lunch or dinner. One dish that you have to try is the Norwegian Salmon Vesuvio. The Salmon fillet is pan seared in a garlic white wine sauce and than served with roasted potato wedges and peas. Just talking about it makes me hungry.

I just had the Gluten Free Pasta Primavera in Garlic Olive Oil, which consist of yellow squash, zucchini, mushrooms, bell peppers, carrots and sweet peas all in a garlic olive oil sauce that is simply amazing. Love Rosebud and excellent service.

I just Love the Breaded Tilapia Sandwich from Rosebud Theater District. A sandwich that is good all year around but I tend to order it more in the fall. The breading is light and the Tilapia is very tasty. Rosebud has quickly become my go to lunch spot and for good reason. They make good food!

Rosebud Theater District is a life saver when you are on the go and working in a busy office. The Homemade Pot Roast special was amazing today and I really needed the comfort food that Rosebud does so well to keeping me going today. Thanks Rosebud for making my day a little brighter.

I actually had reservations at Rosebud Prime which is across the street. After looking at the menu, i decided to stay here. My reservations were at 7:30 and there were only three other tables at the time. The wait staff was very attentive, to the point of
